sub_title: Numismatic Researcher, Layout Designer and Freelance Translator at Pärlan Numismatics, Translations & Design
summary: Experienced Researcher with a demonstrated history of working in the museums and institutions industry. Strong research professional skilled in Art History, Exhibit Design, Visual Arts, Page Layout, and Translations.

position_groups:
[{'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Pärlan Numismatics, Translations & Design', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Driebergen, The Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Pärlan Numismatics, Translations & Design', 'description': 'Numismatic research with specialization in medals

Proposing translations from the following languages: Swedish, French, English and Dutch within the following fields: culture, art, numismatics, gastronomy and children's literature.

Layout and editing work for books, brochures and publications

•	Combining genealogical research with paintings and photographic portraits of the family Boreel in the publication "Het Gezicht van Boreel" 
Including layout and editing work, making and editing pictures and photos (2020-08 – )

•	Layout and editing work of the biennial magazine "Médailles" (issues of 2014, 2016 and 2018) for the International Art Medal Federation (FIDEM) 

•	Layout and editing work of the publication "Johannes Cornelis Wienecke 1872-1945, medailleur en stempelsnijder" (ISBN: 978-94-927-7101-8) for the Royal Dutch Numismatic Society
Including editing of illustrations and photos in the book, translating the catalogue of coins and medals from Dutch to English and writing the summary of the publication in English.

•	Registering modern art medals exhibited at several international congresses into a searchable digital database (http://www.fidem-medals.org/database) (more than 5,000 medals and 1,800 artists are registered)
Including editing of pictures, contact with artists and institutions regarding copyright issues   

•	Layout and design of information leaflets for the International Art Medal Federation (FIDEM)
Including a translation of the English leaflet to French

•	Translated from Dutch to Swedish for Language Lab (Translation agency, Amsterdam, the Netherlands)

•	Digitised the publication "Médailles" (period: 1938-2007) for the International Art Medal Federation (FIDEM)

•	Translated from Swedish to French of the folder Pilgrim Vallentuna for the Parish of Vallentuna known for its archaeological richness in runes and Viking age settlements (Vallentuna Församling, Svenska Kyrkan, Sweden)
Including layout of the folder', 'title': 'Numismatic Research, Freelance Translator and Layout Designer', 'employment_type': 'Self-employed'}]}, {'company': {'id': 1161407, 'name': 'FIDEM - International Art Medal Federation', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEBmPrs7Ja0Qg/company-logo_400_400/0/1631339970015?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=HNghArC0FmKktvy-9DeOtVvOYkObHjLGJsEt023YEZw', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/fidem---international-art-medal-federation/', 'employees': {'start': 2, 'end': 10}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Driebergen, The Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'FIDEM - International Art Medal Federation', 'description': 'see under "Volunteer Experience"', 'title': 'General Secretary | Web Manager | Editor', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 38108, 'name': 'The Frick Collection', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQG-8b9f6mOpCg/company-logo_400_400/0/1630502189141/the_frick_collection_logo?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=SxOiU4aQ-quVzP1xEREUGraMPpQtuZ6RThhciJ3H-d4', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/the-frick-collection/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'The Frick Collection', 'description': '• Introductory essay to the section on Russian and Scandinavian medals in the catalogue "The Scher Collection of Commemorative Medals" (ISBN: 978-1-907804-87-8)

Myntkabinettet - The Royal Coin Cabinet', 'description': '- Head of the medal, token and die collections (ca 100,000 objects)
Classified, organised and registered the medal collection dating from the Renaissance to modern time
Scanned and photographed thousands of objects from the collection
Created and populated a database of artists having made medal and coin designs
Conducted various administrative duties such as registering and describing  new acquisitions, handling loans, photographic requests and  questions from the general public
Gained in-house training on how to handle the collections in case of natural and man influenced disasters as well as integrated pest management

- Responsible for the museum’s internet pages
Regarding general information on opening hours, exhibitions and history of the objects.

- Responsible for the production and creation of several major and smaller exhibitions about medallic art, contemporary artists and the history of economics and trade
2009 - FIDEM 2007 – De svenska bidragen (The Swedish contribution for the FIDEM congress in Colorado Springs, USA) 
2008 - modernized and improved parts of the permanent medal exhibition
2007 - Form x5 (Swedish crystal and medals in a garden)
2005 - FIDEM 2004 – De svenska bidragen (The Swedish contribution for the FIDEM congress in Seixal, Portugal)
2005 - Höganäs – inte bara krus (Swedish company presented through its shares, medals and products)
2005 - Den andra sidan av medaljen (The other side of the medal - three new Swedish artists)
2004 - Ron Dutton – From Landscape to Moonscape (British sculptor and medallist)
2003 - FIDEM 2002 – De svenska bidragen (The Swedish contribution for the FIDEM congress in Paris, France)
2003 - Ernst Nordin – svensk skulptör och medaljkonstnär (Swedish sculptor and medallist)
2001 - En historia om spekulation – från tulpanlök till IT-bubbla (The history of speculation from tulip bulb to IT bubble) 

- Part of "Money in Africa", a joined project with the British Museum and the Geldmuseum', 'title': 'First Curator', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Stockholm, Sweden', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2000}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'company': 'Kungl. volunteer_experiences:
[{'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2000}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'General Secretary | Web Manager | Editor', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'FIDEM - International Art Medal Federation', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQEBmPrs7Ja0Qg/company-logo_400_400/0/1631339970015?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=HNghArC0FmKktvy-9DeOtVvOYkObHjLGJsEt023YEZw', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/fidem---international-art-medal-federation/'}, 'cause': 'ARTS_AND_CULTURE', 'description': '• Key figure in the organisation, being the link between members and the Executive Committee
• Writing the agendas and minutes of meetings
• Keeping the members informed of congresses
• Continuously updating the website with information about worldwide medallic art
• Contributing member of the organizing committee for the congresses held in Sofia (Bulgaria), in 
   Namur and Gent (Belgium), in Ottawa(Canada) and the upcoming congress in Tokyo (Japan)
• Elected editor for the magazine "Médailles" published after every FIDEM congress (2010)
• Elected member of the Executive Committee, in charge of the website (www.fidem-medals.org) (2007)
  Rebuilt the website in 2008 and remodelled it in 2010;  working on a searchable online medal database which will include all the medals from the 34 congresses (http://www.fidem-medals.org/database)
